Introduction.body: Welcome to TJ CSC! During our first meeting, we'll talk about what we do and give you a taste of what to expect in the future.

Basic Linux Commands, Part 1.body: In this meeting, Evan Shi will teach basic linux commands and how to interpret the output of some of these commands. He will introduce tools and commands that are especially useful in CTFs.

Basic Linux Commands, Part 2.body: In this meeting, you will learn more about useful tools and commands that you can apply to CTFs.

Basic Web.body: In this lecture, you will be introduced to standard web problems (ex: robots.txt, cookies, headers) and how to approach them.

Basic Cryptography.body: In this lesson we will go over classical ciphers and basic cryptanalysis techniques.

Review Week.body: No lecture; a challenge session. There will be several problems for you to try, and we will share many helpful practice resources.

Intermediate Cryptography.body: This week we will learn and practice manipulating bits to decrypt messages, and review common hashes and rainbow tables.

Packet Analysis.body: Lecture will be about using Wireshark to conduct packet analysis and simple analysis techniques.

Last 2016 Meeting.body: Fun challenges and maybe a party!

Basic Steganography.body: Lecture will be about common steganographic techniques, such as least significant bit steganography and image metadata.

Sockets.body: In this lecture, we will cover using Python to connect to sockets, and common related problems.

SQL Injection.body: Lecture will be about SQL injection techniques.

Local File Inclusion.body: Lecture will be about local file inclusion vulnerabilities.

Security in File Systems.body: Lecture will be about NTFS, alternate data streams, and recovering deleted files.

Cross Site Scripting.body: Lecture will be about cross site scripting and ways to defend against it.

Memory Forensics.body: Lecture will be about memory forensics techniques and how to use Volatility, an open source memory forensics framework.

Asymmetric Cryptography, Part 1.body: Lecture will cover symmetric and asymmetric cryptography, modular arithmetic, fast arithmetic algorithms, the RSA cryptosystem, RSA signatures, attacks on RSA, and an overview of classical and quantum integer factorization algorithms.

RSA and Reversing.body: We will review how to do EasyCTF RSA problems in A block and learn about reverse engineering B block.

Assembly.body: We will learn about assembly instructions and binary reversing.

picoCTF Problem Review.body: We will review problems from picoCTF 2017.

Binary Exploitation.body: We will learn about binary exploitation.
